title: I need Yasuo advice!
body:
Hello all! as the title suggests i am looking for players that are familiar with Yasuo to give me some advice.

Recently i have been playing alot of Yasuo as i have always loved this champion, i have finally decided to main him and attempt to carry myself out of bronze.

I am looking for some tips on how i should play out the laning phase and how i should be positioning myself for team fights etc, i usually do ok in the laning phase but i'm never quite sure if i should be aggressive and shove the waves or if i should just freeze the lane and farm the best i can without getting myself killed or overextend and die to a gank. another problem i have is during team fights i always find myself being piled because i end up being way to deep in the enemy team when a fight starts and this generally leads to instant death and from there on i can go on tilt and die repeatedly.

I know this is quite a vague description of what i am asking but ultimately i'm just looking for some basic things i should always be doing when playing Yasuo and possibly some advanced lane tactics in order to gain an advantage.

Also how do i deal with ranged casters in the mid lane, should i just be aggressive and shove them under tower repeatedly or be more passive? thanks in advance!

Ok because you are asking for a lot my answer may feel a bit shallow and not meet your expectations but Yasuo is very interesting because being such a high skill cap'd champion you can really try anything.

What I would recommend is to simply assess how much of a threat you are to the enemy team... more threat = more focus yet more carrying capacity.

Ranged opponents are a pushover because they rely on a few abilities for damage that you can easily avoid (unless they are vicktor, then just farm and be ready to dodge). Play aggressive but don't hurt them too much or you will draw the attention of their jgler and not yours, alternatively you can wait for them to overextend but that from my experience can be hard to decifer from a bait.

Hope this helps
